http://www.cnn.com/2003/TECH/space/10/14/china.countdown/index.html
 
 An amazing accomplishment to say that least for the once technologically backward country of China. It does mark a change in power in the world today as China makes it's bid to become an emerging world leader.
 
 I think this event raises several interesting questions.
 
 #1 Will the US be able to keep it's virtual monopoly on space for much longer?
 #2 Does manned space travel help define a country as a world power? Do you respect China more for this accomplishment?
 #3 Is manned space travel even that important?
 #4 Who will be the next to attempted manned space travel?

 Australia was the third country in the world to launch a satellite (decades ago)! No sudden respect came about then. But China's feat is praiseworthy
